intro: [WRONG START] Embilia togoensis, commonly known as Togo wild pepper, is a shrub native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its medicinal properties, it is of interest for both botanical research and potential pharmaceutical applications.
